thread.title: Stefanovic on paparazzi: ‘It’s not good for your health’
thread.title_full: Stefanovic on paparazzi: ‘It’s not good for your health’

title: Stefanovic on paparazzi: ‘It’s not good for your health’
text:
Stefanovic addresses the struggles of being swarmed by photographers news.com.au March 5, 2017 2:01pm 
WHILE he mightn’t be on the same fame level as some of Hollywood’s biggest stars, Karl Stefanovic has definitely had a taste of what it’s like to be swarmed by paparazzi. 
Speaking to Private Sydney yesterday, the Today host spoke about his struggles following his high-profile split from his wife of 21 years Cassandra Thorburn. 
“Having 20 paps on your ass [sic] for three months is not good for your health. Or anyone you are associated with. They are dangerous on the roads as well. Goes with the territory I know but it makes living hard,” he said. 
There’s little doubt the journalist is referring to the unwanted attention since he started seeing model and designer Jasmine Yarbrough. 
The pair reportedly started dating late last year with photos of Karl lying on the deck of a luxury yacht alongside his beautiful blonde model girlfriend splashed across papers last month. media_camera Stefanovic and new girlfriend Jasmine Yarbrough leaving after their day on the luxury yacht. 
Sources told Fairfax his family found out about the new relationship through the paparazzi photos. 
“At no point before it was released in the media did Karl tell [his wife] Cassandra or the children he was in a relationship and that he wanted his girlfriend to meet them,” the source said on February 21. 
Stefanovic split from his wife Cassandra Thorburn back in October after 21 years of marriage, reportedly in part due to the toll The Today Show took on their family. media_camera Stefanovic and his wife Cassandra Thorburn back in 2011. 
For his part, Karl has remained pretty tight-lipped about his private life since the split, but recently opened up to the Herald Sun about the toll it’s taken on his family. 
“For me personally I would definitely have failures in a husband sense and hope that I can rectify my failures as a dad,” Karl told the publication. 
“I hope I can try and rebuild whatever has happened in the past and try and make the most of what I can do with them in the future.” 
The host also spoke about the pressures of the paparazzi on the children. 
“For me the only issue was the burden of paparazzi around my family in the initial months. That is regrettable, that is hard to explain to a kid and I think it is awful for kids,” he said. 
Stefanovic and Thorburn have three kids together: Jackson, 16, Ava, 11, and River, 10.
